questions.question: 1. Which of the following best describes how the Magna Carta came to be law?

choices.answer: The English Parliament voted to get serfs more freedom.
Serfs petitioned by going on strike and refusing to work
King John created the law after his people revolted
English nobles created it and then forced him to sign

questions.question: What was a mock battle that served as a training exercise for young knights?

choices.answer: Cross Fit
Tournaments
Larping
The Agoge

questions.question: This English King led the 3rd Crusade

choices.answer: Charles "The Hammer" Martel
John
Richard the Lionhearted
George III

questions.question: What was the act of taking away a   person’s right to membership in the Church?

choices.answer: Condemnation
Ostracism
Exile
Excommunication

questions.question: How was the Great Schism finally resolved?

choices.answer: The king decided which pope would rule the Holy Roman Empire
A pope was chosen who spoke French and Italian
All popes were forced to resign, and a new pope was elected.
One pope ruled from Rome and another from Constantinople

questions.question: Which group was most responsible for the spread of the Black Death to Europe?

choices.answer: Traders
Farmers
Doctors
Brewers

questions.question: What was the effect of the three-field system?

choices.answer: Fields stayed fertile, allowing farmers to grow more food.
Farmers planted 3 crops at the same time on the same land
Farmers were able to grow food on one third of their land
It was easier to catch fly balls in left and right field.

questions.question: Which of the following events led to the formation of what would be known as Medieval Europe?

choices.answer: Population shift saw many people move to fiefs.
Bubonic Plague killed many people and gave way to a new era.
Charlemagne outlaws Christianity throughout Europe.
People stopped being all evil but were still a bit evil.

questions.question: In what kind of language did Dante Alighieri and Geoffrey Chaucer write?

choices.answer: Old English
Vernacular
Latin
Classical

questions.question: The bargain made between a lord and a vassal was that the…

choices.answer: Vassal would build a city on the lord’s lands.
Lord would defend the vassal in battle.
Lord would grant the vassal land in exchange for service.
Vassal would build a castle.

questions.question: Which of the following best summarizes the lasting effect of the Magna Carta on England?

choices.answer: The Magna Carta gave equal rights to men, women, and slaves
The Magna Carta limited the king's power
The Magna Carta took nobles’ lands and gave them to serfs
The Magna Carta was the hottest mixtape of the 13th century
An organization hired by kings to torture their enemies
The Church Court in Spain that persecuted non Christians
A group tasked with asking questions related to taxes
A shadow organization protecting the Imperium

questions.question: What was the main cause of the 100 years' war?

choices.answer: Who would become the next Pope.
Who would control the English Throne.
Who would control the French Throne.
The Great Schism

questions.question: Which best describes the role of European women in the middle ages?

choices.answer: They gained lots of freedom from the Magna Carta.
They still had very little freedom and were stuck at home or in church.
They gained new freedom due to participation in the church.
They often took control of their land while their husbands were on crusade

questions.question: Which was NOT a result of the crusades?

choices.answer: Feudal lords became more powerful.
The Pope lost some of his political power and influence.
Trade between the Middle East and Europe increased.
New Ideas were imported to Europe from the Middle East.

questions.question: BONUS: Which of the following was a symptom of the black death?

choices.answer: black sores covering the body
being attacked by both English and African swallows
your mother becoming a hamster
The distinct smell of elderberries
